title.rendered: 5 Steak Places You Can Try During 2023 National Finals Rodeo

content.rendered:
Summary

  • 1. Cut by Wolfgang Puck
  • 2. Andiamo Steakhouse
  • 3. Golden Steer Steakhouse Las Vegas
  • 4. Charlie Palmer Steak
  • 5. SW Steakhouse
  • Conclusion

Are you ready for the ride of your life at the National Finals Rodeo 2023? Watching those cowboys and cowgirls wrangle their way to victory will surely produce a mighty appetite.

Lucky for you, I’ve rounded up the 5 best steak places you can try during NFR in Thomas & Mack Center, UNLV, that will have you yell more!

From classic steakhouses to modern eateries, I’ve got it all. So, let’s take a ride through the top spots for steak during the rodeo.

1. Cut by Wolfgang Puck

Cut by Wolfgang Puck is known for its modern take on the classic steakhouse. They cook their steaks on a wood-fired grill, offering them a range of sauces and sides.

Whether you’re a die-hard steak connoisseur or just looking for a little taste of luxury, Cut by Wolfgang Puck has got you covered. They’ve got everything from USDA Prime Nebraska corn-fed, 35-day dry-aged steaks to melt-in-your-mouth Wagyu beef.

And let’s not forget about the amazing atmosphere. With elegant seating, private dining options, and valet parking available, CUT is the perfect spot to indulge in a little luxury during your time in Vegas.

One thing is for sure; You won’t find a better steak place in Vegas during the National Finals Rodeo.

2. Andiamo Steakhouse

The Las Vegas Strip is where you’ll find Del Frisco’s Double Eagle Steakhouse, renowned for its top-notch USDA Prime beef.

Their steaks are dry-aged for 28 days, creating a rich, buttery flavor that will surely please your taste buds. The upscale ambiance and attentive service make this a must-visit steakhouse.

Don’t worry about getting a table, Because this place takes reservations. Plus, they’ve got private dining options if you’re rolling deep with a big group. Want a highchair for your little cowpoke?

They’ve got that covered, too. And if you’re worried about accessibility, there’s no need to fret – Del Frisco’s is wheelchair accessible.

Let’s delve into the main attraction that brought you here – the food. Whether you’re dropping by for a midday meal, an evening feast, or a nighttime nibble, Del Frisco’s has everything you need.

Also, Del Frisco’s has a full bar, so you can wash down that prime beef with a nice cold one.

If you consider everything they offer, Del Frisco’s Double Eagle Steakhouse would be one of the best steak places during the 2023 National Finals Rodeo you are looking for.

3. Golden Steer Steakhouse Las Vegas

Located just a few minutes from the Thomas & Mack Center, Golden Steer Steakhouse has been serving up mouth-watering steaks since 1958. Their aged beef is hand-cut on the premises and cooked to perfection. You’ll find a classic steakhouse experience at Golden Steer.

The Golden Steer is the best steak place to try during the National Finals Rodeo. Their aged beef is hand-cut right on the premises and perfectly cooked. No wonder they’ve been around for so long; they know how to do steak right.

But the Golden Steer isn’t just any old steakhouse. This place is steeped in history, and it shows. From the classic decor to the friendly service, you’ll feel like you’ve stepped back in time.

They’ve got all the modern amenities you could want. Whether you’re looking for private dining, wheelchair accessibility, or a cold one at the full bar, the Golden Steer covers you.

Golden Steer is the place to be if you’re looking for a perfect way to treat your cowboy or cowgirl after a long day of rodeo action.

4. Charlie Palmer Steak

Charlie Palmer Steak is a sophisticated steakhouse serving prime cuts of beef, fresh seafood, and other dishes.

Their steaks are cooked using various methods, Such as wood-fired grilling and sous-vide cooking. They use these methods to create texture and flavor. They also have an extensive wine list, perfect for pairing with your meal.

Charlie Palmer has created a spot where everything is bigger and better, just like the rodeo. The ambiance is perfect for those who want to kick back and relax away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

It’s like a luxurious clubhouse where you can enjoy peace and quiet while chowing down on some top-notch grub.

Charlie Palmer Steak has a wine list that’ll knock your boots off. They specialize in Napa Valley Cabernet and Pinot Noir from up and down the West Coast. But they also got some old-world wines from France, Spain, and Italy.

They have everything you need to make your experience top-notch, from private dining to validated parking. The place is even wheelchair accessible, so everyone can join the fun. They have live music and a jazz bar, so you can get into that western swing.

So, head over to Charlie Palmer Steak if you want to sink your teeth into some mouth-watering steak during the 2023 National Finals Rodeo.

5. SW Steakhouse

SW Steakhouse offers an elegant dining experience with stunning views of the Lake of Dreams. Their menu features a wide range of steaks, including Wagyu beef, seafood, and other delicious dishes.

Additionally, the restaurant has a comprehensive wine list, perfect for pairing with your steak.

Everyone’s invited to come and chow down on some top-quality grub, from carnivores to vegans. Chef David Walzog sure knows how to grill them up right! Their wine list is longer than a rodeo bull’s horns, so you can find the perfect pairing for your steak.

The views of the Lake of Dreams are simply jaw-dropping, and you can even catch a water show while you eat. They also have all the bells and whistles, like reservations, outdoor seating, private dining, and valet parking.

Whether you’re coming for dinner or a late-night snack, SW Steakhouse will serve you a heaping plate of deliciousness.

Conclusion

If you’re looking for the best steak places to check out during the 2023 National Finals Rodeo, then be sure to add these five restaurants to your list.

From classic steakhouses to modern takes on the traditional steakhouse, there’s something for every taste and budget.

Whether you’re craving a classic filet or a more unconventional Wagyu beef cut, these restaurants will satisfy your appetite for a tasty and succulent steak.
